title: MySQLLEAST()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLLEAST()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the smallest value of the list of arguments:
SELECT LEAST(3, 12, 34, 8, 25);

Definition and Usage
The LEAST() function returns the smallest value of the list of arguments.
Note:
See also the
GREATEST()
function.
Syntax
LEAST(
arg1
,
arg2
,
arg3
, ...)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
arg1
,
arg2
,
arg3
, ...
Required. The list of arguments to be evaluated
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return the smallest value of the list of arguments:
SELECT LEAST(".com", "microsoft.com", "apple.com");

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLLEAST()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLLEAST()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLLEAST()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
